monogr.title: Drum Beats: Walt Whitman's Civil War Boy Lovers

bibl.author: Manvill Wintersteen
bibl.title: Manvill Wintersteen to Walt Whitman, 10 March 1875
bibl.idno: Berg Coll MSS Whitman Series IV
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I am glad to have the pleasurpleasure of wrightingwriting to you again I receicvedreceived your welcome letter lost and papers, and in your picturpicture witchwhich I prisedprized very much and knew the old friendly face in a moment lokslooks very naturelnatural in deadindeed and I would like to spend a few oureshours' talk with youI think we could enjoy a day if not moreI shalshall never forget your hospitality and friendly gifts in time of need may god help you throuthrough this world of trouble

I had bad luck with my soildiersoldier money I had a good home and went in pardnershippartnership with a friend. I thotthought but proved untrue so that is the way with this world a pencionpension agent stopedstopped here last knightnight and I showed him your picture he was glad he knew you in a minitminute was surprised to think I had your picturpicture I told him I never expected to see you again. I would not take a goodeelgood deal for the pictureI expect to see you sum timesometime I know you are living. Mother remembers the hand rightinghandwriting of a letter that you wrote in the Hospital for me thankful to you for itI will rightwrite you more if you can read this. so good buygoodbye for this time and

closer.salute: in love and good wishes to you hope to see you.
